item.title: 马来西亚和新加坡探讨从越南进口风能
item.description: 新加坡、马来西亚和越南的主要电力公司已同意探索跨境可再生能源连接，东南亚正采取措施实现其长期以来建立区域超级电网的愿景。【原文：Major power companies in Singapore, Malaysia and Vietnam have agreed to explore renewable energy links across their borders, as Southeast Asia takes steps to realize its long-held vision of a regional supergrid.】

item.title: 印度首次推出新天气模型帮助农业和洪水规划
item.description: 今年西南季风提前抵达印度，这对农作物来说是个好消息，但未来几个月降雨的具体时间、地点和降雨量仍是难以回答的问题。【原文：The southwest monsoon’s early arrival in India this year is good news for crops, but exactly when, where, and how much rain will fall over the next few months are still difficult questions to answer.】

item.title: 一艘船在印度南部海岸沉没后发现漏油现象
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度相关机构已发现一艘集装箱船周日早些时候在印度南部喀拉拉邦海岸附近倾覆时发生漏油事故。【原文：Indian agencies have spotted an oil spillage from a container ship that capsized off the country’s southern coast in Kerala early Sunday, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚在国家电力计划中减少天然气用量，支持可再生能源
item.description: 印尼在其最新的国家电力计划中旨在加强可再生能源的建设，同时缩减电网的天然气增量。【原文：Indonesia aims to boost the buildout of renewable energy in its latest national power plan, scaling back gas additions to the grid.】

item.title: 台湾将就重启已关闭核反应堆举行公投
item.description: 台湾将就重启上周刚刚关闭的一座核反应堆举行全民公决，这有可能为扭转政府的反核政策开辟一条道路。【原文：Taiwan will hold a national referendum on restarting a nuclear reactor that it shut down just last week, potentially opening up a pathway to reverse the government’s anti-nuclear policy.】

item.title: 安联全球投资经理称美国面临失去 "可靠投资 "地位的风险
item.description: 在欧洲最大的资产管理公司之一内部，越来越多的人担心，共和党努力削减支持清洁能源等关键产业的立法，可能会导致美国失去作为投资者资本目的地的地位。【原文：Inside one of Europe’s biggest asset managers, there’s growing concern that Republican efforts to gut legislation supporting key industries such as clean energy may result in the US losing its status as a destination for investor capital.】

item.title: 澳大利亚东海岸开始清理洪水，水位逐渐回升
item.description: 在东部新南威尔士州发生毁灭性洪灾后，澳大利亚已从全国各地征召应急服务队，帮助开展清理行动。【原文：Australia has drafted in emergency service teams from across the nation to help with clean-up operations after devastating floods in the eastern state of New South Wales.】

item.title: 美国 200 亿美元家用太阳能市场的命运掌握在国会参议院手中
item.description:
高管警告称，众议院税收法案将削弱屋顶太阳能产业。【原文：

House tax bill would gut the rooftop solar industry, executives warn.

】

item.title: 纽约时报》称美国环保局欲终止对发电厂的温室气体排放限制
item.description: 据《纽约时报》援引该机构内部文件报道，美国环境保护局已起草计划，取消对美国化石燃料发电厂温室气体排放的限制。【原文：The US Environmental Protection Agency has drafted plans to remove limits on greenhouse gases from fossil fuel-fired power plants in the US, the New York Times reported, citing internal agency documents.】

item.title: 印度季风提前到来，主要作物前景看好
item.description: 季风是一种浇灌印度一半以上农田的天气现象，这次季风比往年更早到达印度次大陆，改善了农作物的收成前景，使人们希望印度将取消对农产品出口的剩余限制。【原文：The monsoon, a weather phenomenon that waters more than half of India’s farmland, reached the subcontinent earlier than usual, boosting crop outlook and raising hopes the nation will lift remaining curbs on exports of farm goods.】

item.title: 巴西里奥阿托公司与债务重组顾问合作
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，巴西可再生能源公司 Rio Alto Energias Renovaveis SA 正在与金融咨询公司 Laplace Finanças 和律师事务所 Felsberg Advogados 合作，担任债务重组顾问。【原文：Brazilian renewable energy company Rio Alto Energias Renovaveis SA is working with financial advisory firm Laplace Finanças and law firm Felsberg Advogados as debt restructuring advisers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 卡尼的能源主管推动油砂公司建立碳捕集系统
item.description: 加拿大新任能源部长表示，为油砂建立碳捕集系统至关重要，并将原油和天然气出口确定为总理马克-卡尼政府的主要优先事项。【原文：Canada’s new energy minister said it’s critical to build carbon-capture systems for the oil sands and identified crude and natural gas exports as a major priority for Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government.】

item.title: 欧洲春季干旱引发对小麦和大麦收成的担忧
item.description: 在经历了异常干旱的春季之后，欧洲大片地区的农场变得干涸，这表明气候变化对本土谷物的威胁日益严重。【原文：Farms across wide swaths of Europe are parched after an unusually dry spring, evidence of the increasing threat of climate change to homegrown grains.】

item.title: 炎热的夜晚和饥饿的蚊子我们可怕的温暖世界
item.description: 今天的通讯报道了全球变暖的另一个可怕后果：蚊子传播疾病的增加。我们驻伦敦的气象记者乔-韦茨（Joe Wertz）首先报道了英国最近发现西尼罗河病毒这一令人震惊的消息。随后，我们的气候与健康记者艾玛-考特（Emma Court）向我们介绍了在减缓疟疾传播方面可能取得的突破。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter covers another terrible consequence of global warming: the increased spread of mosquito-borne diseases. Our London-based weather reporter Joe Wertz first looks at the alarming news that West Nile virus was recently detected in the UK. Later, our climate and health reporter Emma Court tells us about a potential breakthrough in slowing the spread of malaria. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 休闲艇开始电动化。乘坐体验如下
item.description:
初创企业正在推出可减少噪音和污染的电动船型，但大多数电动船的价格仍高于汽油动力船。【原文：

Startups are rolling out electric boat models that cut noise and pollution, though prices for most are still higher than gas-powered versions.

】

item.title: 前特工加入打击贩毒集团支持的野生动物走私者的战斗
item.description:
随着偷猎者的利润飙升，更多有组织的犯罪团伙被吸引到这一行业中来，一个 "地球情报机构 "正在追踪跨国界的偷猎活动。【原文：

As profits for poachers have soared, drawing more organized criminal groups into the trade, an "intelligence agency for Earth" is tracking the operation across borders.

】

item.title: 今年春季英国比西班牙度假胜地阳光更充足
item.description: 由于西北欧上空的高压系统打破了典型的天气模式，今年春季英国和德国的阳光比西班牙和葡萄牙更充足。【原文：The UK and Germany were sunnier than Spain and Portugal this spring, as high-pressure systems over northwest Europe upended typical weather patterns.】

item.title: 客户撤资 140 亿美元后，Impax 首席执行官称最糟糕的时期已经过去
item.description: Impax Asset Management Group Plc 首席执行官表示，该公司监管的资金池不太可能进一步缩水，因为在一系列客户赎回之后，该公司正试图扭亏为盈。【原文：The chief executive officer of Impax Asset Management Group Plc said the pool of money it oversees is unlikely to shrink further, as the firm tries to right itself after a series of client redemptions.】

item.title: 洪水袭击悉尼北部地区，四人死亡，更多降雨即将到来
item.description: 强风暴袭击了澳大利亚人口最多的州，造成至少四人死亡，数千人停电。【原文：At least four people died and thousands are without power as severe storms lashed Australia’s most populous state.】

item.title: 中国锂城是电池贸易战的前沿阵地
item.description:
北京希望建立以国内供应为基础的高科技经济，即使这需要付出代价。【原文：

Beijing wants a high-tech economy built on domestic supply, even if it comes at a cost.

】

item.title: 新加坡附近的岛屿度假胜地受到中国冶炼厂的威胁
item.description: 中国最大的铝业公司之一威胁要破坏作为新加坡游客首选度假胜地的群岛的宁静，引发抗议。【原文：One of China’s biggest aluminum companies is threatening to disrupt the serenity of a cluster of islands that are a top holiday destination for Singapore visitors, sparking protests.】

item.title: 魁北克投资者拯救破产的电动巴士制造商 Lion
item.description: 魁北克法官将批准一项旨在挽救 Lion Electric Co. 公司免于破产的交易，但股东和大多数债权人将不会获得任何收益。【原文：A Quebec judge will approve a transaction aimed at saving Lion Electric Co. from bankruptcy, but shareholders and most creditors will not receive any proceeds.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称水是欧洲经济面临的最大自然风险
item.description: 根据欧洲中央银行和牛津大学研究人员的研究，水已成为欧元区经济面临的最大自然风险。【原文：Water has emerged as the single biggest nature-related risk to euro area economy, according to the European Central Bank and researchers at the University of Oxford.】

item.title: 参议院投票决定终止加州汽油车禁令，并将法案提交给特朗普
item.description: 美国参议院投票否决了加利福尼亚州到 2035 年禁止使用汽油动力汽车和其他车辆的计划，并将该措施提交给唐纳德-特朗普总统签署。【原文：The US Senate voted to block a California program banning gasoline-powered cars and other vehicles by 2035, sending the measure to President Donald Trump’s desk for his signature.】

item.title: 企鹅粪便可限制全球变暖对南极洲的影响
item.description: 一项科学研究显示，南极洲的大型企鹅群有能力影响大气层，并可能有助于减少气候变化的影响。【原文：Large colonies of penguins in Antarctica have an ability to influence the atmosphere and could be helping reduce the impact of climate change, according to a scientific study.】

item.title: 遭遇建设挫折后，EDF 开始审查可再生能源项目
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）在风力发电场开发项目中遭遇施工障碍和成本超支后，可能会对可再生能源项目采取更加谨慎的态度。【原文：Electricite de France SA may adopt a more cautious approach to renewable-energy projects after encountering construction snags and cost overruns for wind-farm developments.】

item.title: 德意志银行以法律风险为由暂停石油限制措施
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席执行官表示，德意志银行不会继续推进增加石油和天然气融资限制的计划，因为德意志银行正在评估这样做的法律风险。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG won’t move ahead with a plan to add restrictions on financing oil and gas, as it assesses the legal risks of doing so, according to its chief executive.】

item.title: 美国国会众议院通过法案取消补贴，太阳能股票大跌
item.description: 前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）具有里程碑意义的气候法以微弱优势获得众议院通过后，一项大规模税收和支出法案将被废除，清洁能源股票的投资者正纷纷逃离。【原文：Investors of clean-power stocks are running for the exits after a massive tax and spending bill that would gut former President Joe Biden’s landmark climate law narrowly passed the House of Representatives.】

item.title: 微软为何刚刚签署了一项绿色水泥协议
item.description:
这家软件巨头正在与一家低碳水泥初创公司合作，帮助解决数据中心建设过程中的排放问题。【原文：

The software giant is teaming up with a low-carbon cement startup to help address emissions from the construction of data centers.

】

item.title: 特朗普的资金威胁为私营高速铁路提供了依据
item.description:
当加州高速铁路的联邦资金受到质疑时，由私人主导的西部光明线（Brightline West）却一直在艰难前行。【原文：

While California High-Speed Rail’s federal funding is in doubt, privately led Brightline West has been chugging along. 

】
